Package pathfinder

Class Grid2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • pathfinder.Grid2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Grid

    public class Grid2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements Grid
    This class implements Grid for a 2D map where Individuals can move. Thus, it stores information in a 2D Matrix of integers, Map, with dimension (number_rows*number_columns)x4. Each row of this matrix represents a Point, and each line is the cost of moving to one direction, counting counter clockwise.
    See Also:
    initializeGrid(), ValidSegments(Point)

    • Field Detail

      • Map

        int[][] Map
        2D int Matrix where cost for each of movement directions is stored.

        Zero cost means opposite site of segment is an obstacle.

      • r

        ReadFile r
        Read File used to extract information from XML.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGrid

        public int initializeGrid​()
        This method reads the specifications of the map obtained from the XML and builds a Map. A Map is represented by a 2D int vector, in which the first dimension represents the index of the point on the grid and the second dimension represents it's four adjacent segments. 0 - Left, 1 - Up, 2 - Right, 3- Down For example, the Map[13][2] stores the value of the segment on the right of point 13.
        Specified by:
        initializeGrid in interface Grid
        Returns:
        Maximum cost in the grid

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        This method is an override of the toString method() to print the contents of the map.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Map information

        Returns:

      • ValidSegments

        public java.util.LinkedList<Segment> ValidSegments​(Point A)
        This method receives a point, and returns the linked list of valid segments for which the individual can travel.

        This is done by checking the map at the index of the point and evaluating all the four segments. If the cost of the segment is different than zero, than the segment is added to the list.

        Specified by:
        ValidSegments in interface Grid
        Parameters:
        A - current point of the individual
        Returns:
        Linked List of Segments
        See Also:
        Point, Segment, Individual
